reqs:
Pre-reqs: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 263.
The SIS will enforce automatically prerequisites for this course. Students will not be able to register themselves if they do not have the correct prerequisites. If you need to get your UBC file updated with qualifications such as Transfer Credits, take care of that by sending documentation to admissions.inquiry@ubc.ca.

description: Sets and functions; induction; cardinality; properties of the real numbers; sequences, series, and limits. Logic, structure, style, and clarity of proofs emphasized throughout.
